question: According to the National EMS Scope of Practice Model, an EMT should be able to:
answers: interpret a basic (ECG) rhythm and treat accordingly.
insert a peripheral IV line and infuse fluids.
administer epinephrine via the subcutaneous route.
assist a patient with certain prescribed medications.
correctAnswers: assist a patient with certain prescribed medications.
selectedAnswer: interpret a basic (ECG) rhythm and treat accordingly.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: An EMS provider who has extensive training in various aspects of advanced life support (ALS) is called a(n):
answers: paramedic.
advanced EMT (AEMT).
EMR.
EMT.
correctAnswers: paramedic.
selectedAnswer: advanced EMT (AEMT).
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: As an EMT, you may be authorized to administer aspirin to a patient with chest pain based on:
answers: the transport time to the hospital.
medical director approval.
an order from a paramedic.
the patient's condition.
correctAnswers: medical director approval.
selectedAnswer: medical director approval.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Continuing education in EMS serves to:
answers: provide an ongoing review and audit of the EMS system.
confirm research and statistical findings in prehospital care.
enforce mandatory attendance at agency-specific training.
maintain, update, and expand the EMT's knowledge and skills.
correctAnswers: maintain, update, and expand the EMT's knowledge and skills.
selectedAnswer: maintain, update, and expand the EMT's knowledge and skills.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: EMS as we know it today had its origins in 1966 with the publication of:
answers: the Department of Transportation's White Paper: Death and Dying.
Emergency Care and Transportation of the Sick and Injured.
Accidental Death and Disability: The Neglected Disease of Modern Society.
the Emergency Medical Services Act.
correctAnswers: Accidental Death and Disability: The Neglected Disease of Modern Society.
selectedAnswer: Accidental Death and Disability: The Neglected Disease of Modern Society.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: EMT training in nearly every state meets or exceeds the guidelines recommended by the:
answers: individual state's EMS protocols.
National Registry of EMTs.
National Association of EMTs.
National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).
correctAnswers: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).
selectedAnswer: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: If an EMT candidate has been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor, he or she should:
answers: wait at least 24 months before taking another state-approved EMT class.
send an official request to the National Registry of EMTs (NREMT) to seek approval to take the EMT exam.
contact the state EMS office and provide its staff with the required documentation.
recognize that any such conviction will disqualify him or her from EMT licensure.
correctAnswers: contact the state EMS office and provide its staff with the required documentation.
selectedAnswer: contact the state EMS office and provide its staff with the required documentation.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Obtaining continuing medical education is the responsibility of the:
answers: EMS training officer.
State Bureau of EMS.
individual EMT.
EMS medical director.
correctAnswers: individual EMT.
selectedAnswer: individual EMT.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The continuous quality improvement (CQI) process is designed to:
answers: identify areas of improvement and provide remedial training if needed.
focus specifically on the quality of emergency care provided to the patient.
ensure that all EMTs maintain licensure through the state EMS office.
administer punitive actions to EMTs who do not follow local protocols.
correctAnswers: identify areas of improvement and provide remedial training if needed.
selectedAnswer: focus specifically on the quality of emergency care provided to the patient.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The EMT certification exam is designed to:
answers: rank EMTs based on performance on the certification exam.
ensure that EMTs are competent and have the same level of knowledge and skills.
provide EMTs with the best possible wage once certification is achieved.
identify those EMTs who are prepared for advanced levels of training.
correctAnswers: ensure that EMTs are competent and have the same level of knowledge and skills.
selectedAnswer: ensure that EMTs are competent and have the same level of knowledge and skills.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The person who is responsible for authorizing EMTs to perform emergency medical care in the field is the:
answers: field training officer.
EMS administrator.
shift supervisor.
medical director.
correctAnswers: medical director.
selectedAnswer: medical director.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The standards for prehospital emergency care and the individuals who provide it are typically regulated by the:
answers: state office of EMS.
American Heart Association.
National Registry of EMTs.
regional trauma center.
correctAnswers: state office of EMS.
selectedAnswer: state office of EMS.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following is an example of a primary prevention strategy?
answers: Community awareness programs that emphasize the dangers of drinking and driving
Teaching a group of new parents how to perform one- and two-rescuer infant CPR
The construction of a guardrail on a dangerous curve following a fatal motor vehicle crash
Protecting a patient's spine from further injury after a fall from a significant height
correctAnswers: Community awareness programs that emphasize the dangers of drinking and driving
selectedAnswer: Community awareness programs that emphasize the dangers of drinking and driving
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following scenarios involves the administration of ALS?
answers: A 64-year-old patient who is given aspirin for suspected cardiac chest pain
A 61-year-old patient who is receiving humidified supplemental oxygen
A 48-year-old patient whose airway is secured with a supraglottic device
A 53-year-old patient who is assisted with his prescribed nitroglycerin
correctAnswers: A 48-year-old patient whose airway is secured with a supraglottic device
selectedAnswer: A 48-year-old patient whose airway is secured with a supraglottic device
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following skills or interventions is included at every level of prehospital emergency training?
answers: Automated external defibrillation
Use of a manually triggered ventilator
Intranasal medication administration
Oral glucose for hypoglycemia
correctAnswers: Automated external defibrillation
selectedAnswer: Automated external defibrillation
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following skills would a layperson most likely be trained to perform before the arrival of EMS?
answers: Insertion of an oropharyngeal airway
Bleeding control using a tourniquet
Administration of supplemental oxygen
Obtaining a manual blood pressure
correctAnswers: Bleeding control using a tourniquet
selectedAnswer: Bleeding control using a tourniquet
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following statements regarding the EMS medical director and an EMT's scope of practice is correct?
answers: The EMS medical director can expand or limit an individual EMT's scope of practice without state approval.
An EMT's scope of practice may be expanded by the medical director after proper training and state approval.
The EMS medical director can expand the EMT's scope of practice but cannot limit it without state approval.
An EMT's scope of practice is exclusively regulated by the state EMS office, not the EMS medical director.
correctAnswers: An EMT's scope of practice may be expanded by the medical director after proper training and state approval.
selectedAnswer: An EMT's scope of practice may be expanded by the medical director after proper training and state approval.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following statements regarding the NREMT is correct?
answers: The NREMT provides a national standard for EMS testing.
The NREMT is the exclusive certifying body for EMTs.
The NREMT is a governmental agency that certifies EMTs.
The NREMT regulates EMS training standards.
correctAnswers: The NREMT provides a national standard for EMS testing.
selectedAnswer: The NREMT provides a national standard for EMS testing.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which type of medical direction do standing orders and protocols describe?
answers: Off-line
Direct
Online
Radio
correctAnswers: Off-line
selectedAnswer: Off-line
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Why are prehospital emergency care guidelines updated on a regular basis?
answers: Additional information and evidence indicate that the effectiveness of certain interventions has changed.
Statistical data indicate that an increasing number of people are being diagnosed with a particular illness.
The federal government requires the implementation of changes to existing emergency care protocols at least every five years.
EMS providers should be encouraged to actively participate in research and become familiar with data analysis.
correctAnswers: Additional information and evidence indicate that the effectiveness of certain interventions has changed.
selectedAnswer: Additional information and evidence indicate that the effectiveness of certain interventions has changed.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)
